subject: Programming
title: The Birth of FORTRAN
description: A quick, practical guide to The Birth of FORTRAN.

hook.text: In the 1950s, programming a simple math formula took dozens of assembly instructions.

buildup.text: John Backus at IBM proposed a radical idea: let programmers write formulas directly.

discovery.text: FORTRAN launched in 1957 as the first widely used high-level programming language.

twist.text: Critics said it would produce slow code. FORTRAN's compiler matched hand-written assembly.

climax.text: Scientists adopted it overnight. Code that took weeks now took hours to write.

punchline.text: One language changed who could program.
